Exaggerate: The claim in the Facebook post exaggerates the situation by suggesting that Senator Mitt Romney is the only Republican Senator who voted to remove President Trump from office and also has a son on the board of a Ukrainian Energy Company. This is not supported by evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to substantiate the statement that Senator Mitt Romney's son sits on the board of a Ukrainian Energy Company.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the Twitter account @AGWilliamBarr belongs to Attorney General William Barr. However, it is a parody account and not affiliated with the actual Attorney General.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no evidence exists to support the assertion that Senator Mitt Romney's son is involved with a Ukrainian Energy Company.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting misleading information and attributing it to Attorney General William Barr when it is actually from a parody account.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation presented in the claim.
